intro: Brachystegia diloloensis var. subglabra, commonly known as the smooth-bracted brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by small, spherical fruits containing one or two seeds. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
